duties_responsibilities.duty: Oversee Engineering Division office activities, including approving material requisitions and invoices, monitoring budget status, and ordering ballast weekly.
Coordinate inquiries from the field and system personnel, compile weekly reports, and oversee division vehicle registration and licensing.
Handle labor matters, labor investigations, and approve or decline labor claims and grievances.
Represent the Division Engineer at meetings in their absence, and handle new hire contract process and training.
Review injury reports, conduct follow-up investigations, and prepare trend analysis, reports, and presentations.

Coordinate the morning conference call to collect data from field officers, recruit, interview, and train union and non-union subordinates, and handle material distribution for all disciplines of Engineering.
Compile weekly reports on various activities and responsibilities as assigned by manager.
Wear protective equipment, work variable hours, and work inside an office environment.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's Degree in Civil Engineering, Structural Engineering, or Construction (Master's preferred)
